title: Where have all the Scottish Tories gone?
text:
You may not have noticed, or even cared, but the Scottish Parliament has been enjoying its two week October recess which finishes tomorrow.

It’s commonly known by some rougher elements as the "tattie holidays", as a nod in the direction of the day when the country’s farmers enlisted the aid of schoolchildren to bring in the potato harvest.

There is no suggestion that our tribunes get involved in such strenuous work nowadays, but as they get back to work at Holyrood – and, take note, it hasn’t been such a recess at Westminster – it’s not being unfair to ask: Where have the Scottish Tories been?

Time and time again we’ve seen and heard from the SNP’s Ian Blackford and Joanna Cherry as well as the...
description: You may not have noticed, or even cared, but the Scottish Parliament has been enjoying its two week October recess which finishes tomorrow.
